Stem: Slender with reddish or yellow spines.
Leaves: Oblong to lance shaped 2-10 cm long, with white hairs covering surfaces, giving them silvery appearance.
Flowers: Typical nightshade blueish purple to occasionally pink or white 2-4 cm diameter, 5 fused petals with yellow stamens.
FruitSeeds: Green to yellow or brownish (when ripe) berries, containing 38-89 tomato-like seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Leaves with silver appearance due to whitish hairs, but otherwise can closely resemble other *Solanum* species.
Impacts: Reduces crop yields through competition, pest and disease vector, can be toxic to some stock.
